DataElement.preferredName: Prior Antiandrogen Therapy Recurrent Disease Metastatic Neoplasm Administered Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether or not treatment with drugs used to block production or interfere with the action of male sex hormones was previously given to treat either the return of a disease after a period of remission or for a tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Antiandrogen Therapy Recurrent Disease Metastatic Neoplasm Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Treatment with drugs used to block production or interfere with the action of male sex hormones._The return of a disease after a period of remission._A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Treatment with drugs used to block production or interfere with the action of male sex hormones.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic regimen that utilizes pharmaceuticals to reduce serum levels of male sex hormones.

Property.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.:A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
